comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Adequate definition monochrome copy of a color picture available in print elsewhere. Grumman A-6A Intruder Bu No 155644 in the markings of VAH-128 'Golden Intruders’ with Modex code number 800 below cockpit windshield and tail code NJ used by the squadron plus gold banding with black stripes across tail originally applied to A-6 aircraft in precursor unit VA-123 'Professionals'. VA-128 was based at NAS Whidbey Island, Washington State. The US West coast Replacement Air Group/Fleet Replacement Squadron that provided training services for A-6 aviators and maintainers. VA-128 info courtesy of the 'Intruder Association': www.intruderassociation.org/ www.intruderassociation.org/squadrons.html www.intruderassociation.org/squadrons/va128.html A color version of the picture may be viewed on page 18 of publication “COLORS & MARKINGS OF U.S. NAVY CAG AIRCRAFT C&M VOL.16 PART 2 - ATTACK AIRCRAFT A-6 INTRUDER A-7 CORSAIR” by Bert Kinzey & Ray Leader which is internet downloadable. Quoted caption reads: "The only marking that indicated that A-6A, 155644 was the 800 modex on the nose. This photograph was taken at Edwards Air Force Base, California in May 1969. The squadron badge was located on the fuselage behind the canopy." (Spering/A.I.R.) Identified by its 800 Modex code, this was a designated aircraft for an air wing commander or historically 'Commander Air Group' or CAG. Aircraft wearing a three digit Modex number with digits 00 after the first number are normally spoken of as the 'CAG plane'. Behind is the tail top from a KA-3B Skywarrior with code NP of Carrier Air Wing Twenty One (CVW-21) possibly belonging to VAH-10 'Vikings' that served on CVA-19 USS HANCOCK between August 2, 1969 & April 15, 1970 during the Vietnam War A record for VAH-10 on this 'GO!NAVY' webpage: www.gonavy.jp/CVW-NPf.html From 1970 A-6A 155644 became part of a regular carrier squadron: www.gonavy.jp/CVW9-NG1970.html A-6A 155644 was with VA-165 ‘Boomers’ as Modex 501, part of air wing CVW-9 (NG) aboard CVA-66 USS AMERICA between April 10 & December 21, 1970 for the Vietnam War. 1971-1972 record including A-6A 155644 still with VA-165: www.gonavy.jp/CVW9-NG1972.html A-6A 155644 of VA-165 'Boomers' now as Modex 500, with CVW-9 (NG) aboard CVA-64 CONSTELLATION from October 1,1971 to July 1,1972 for deployment to the Vietnam War. 1981 dated pencil drawing of A-6A 155644 in 1972: www.markwaki.com/pages/A-6A Pencil.htm 1973 ‘flickr’ pic of A-6A 155644: www.flickr.com/photos/tailspin_tommy/425989681/ CVA-64 USS CONSTELLATION was deployed between January 5th & October 11th 1973 - again for the Vietnam War with Carrier Air Wing 9 (CVW-9) tail code NG assigned to it. A-6A 155644 still with VA-165 'Boomers' as Modex 500 1973 ‘flickr’ pic with A-6A 155644 included among the aircraft tightly packed on the hangar deck of CVA-64 USS CONSTELLATION: www.flickr.com/photos/tailspin_tommy/425989681/ Quote taken from comment below picture: “There is an A-6 tail just above '12', the double numbers '00' denote a 'CAG' plane of that particular squadron, being VA-165 equipped with A-6A/KA-6D. '00' denoting Modex 500 Bu number 155644.” There is a good 1973 picture of A-6A 155644 with VA-165 'Boomers' as Modex 500 tail code NG caught being ‘trapped’ aboard USS Constellation on page 24 and a color profile within page 40 available to view from a publication that may be freely downloaded off the internet - if searched for; “USN AIRCRAFT CARRIER AIR UNITS Volume 3 1964 – 1973” By Duane Kasulka Squadron Signal 6162. 1973 record including A-6A 155644: www.gonavy.jp/CVW9-NG1973.html CVA-64 USS CONSTELLATION was deployed between January 5th & October 11th 1973 (Vietnam War) Carrier Air Wing 9 (CVW-9) tail code NG was assigned to it. A-6A 155644 was still surviving as Modex 500 with VA-165. 1974 record including A-6A 155644: www.gonavy.jp/CVW9-NG1974.html CVW-9 & CV-64 USS CONSTELLATION from June 21 to December 23, 1974 A Western Pacific, Vietnam War plus the Arabian Gulf trek possibly in aftermath of an Arab Israeli war during October 1973 (Yom Kippur War) A-6A 155644 was still flying with VA-165 ‘Boomers’ as Modex 500. Some time in the 1970's Intruder Bu No 155644 was put into the update program to become an A-6E. 1980-1981 record including A-6E 155644: www.gonavy.jp/CVW1-AB1980.html Carrier Air Wing One (CVW-1) code AB was assigned to CV-67 USS JOHN F.KENNEDY for a Mediterranean Sea patrol between August 8, 1980 & March 28, 1981 A-6E 155644 is recorded with VA-34 ‘Blue Blaster’ as Modex 507 1991 to 1994 record including A-6E 155644 www.gonavy.jp/CVW5-NF1991-2.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW5-NF1992.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW5-NF1993.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW5-NF1994.html Some time between September 1991 & December 1994 A-6E 155644 flew with VA-115 ‘Eagles’ as Modex 512. In 1994 it was replaced by another A-6E Intruder. This was as part of permanently forward deployed air wing CVW-5 (code NF) based at NAF Atsugi in Japan, flying from CV-62 USS INDEPENDENCE, home ported at Yokosuka and also forward deployed. (GO!NAVY' website info is gathered on a purely voluntary basis and may be fragmentary. It's extremely fortunate when records of individual aircraft serial numbers assigned to squadrons are available. For which recognition and appreciation of Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan and naval air historian for all ‘GO!NAVY’ references is well deserved) 1994 color picture of A-6E 155644: www.gonavy.jp/bbs2-a6f.html Scroll down and click on picture above caption titled; A-6E TRAM 155644/NF-512 (1994) T.SPARK No.397 After the 1991 US defense cuts the A-6 fleet was gradually reduced before complete withdrawal. In 1994 A-6E 155644 (c/n I-370) was recorded in storage at Naval Air Depot, NAS North Island, California. After ‘demilitarisation’ (so it won’t ever fly again) A-6E 155644 went direct from storage to the "Yanks Air Museum", Chino, California and was placed in a compound behind their restoration hangar. Yanks Air Museum official internet website: www.yanksair.com/index.html www.yanksair.com/BoneyardTarmac.html Yanks Air Museum location and access info: www.aviationmuseum.eu/World/North_America/USA/California/... Grumman A-6E Intruder 155644 is marked with tail code NF and Modex 521. There is a sad picture of A-6E 155644 dated 2002 at 'Yanks' here: www.warbirdregistry.org/jetregistry/a6-155644.html Four more pictures of A-6E 155644 at 'Yanks' in semi derelict and deteriorating condition: www.airliners.net/search/photo.search?regsearch=155644 An opinion – if A-6E 155644 is still in this condition – it reflects badly on the reputation of the museum.
